Additionally, modernization has made it easier to promote and market traditional practices and festivals to a wider audience, both domestically and internationally, leading to greater awareness and appreciation of Jilin province's culture.

On the other hand, modernization could have a negative impact on cultural heritage if traditional practices and festivals are neglected and forgotten. Rapid urbanization and globalization could lead to the loss of cultural identity as people prioritize modern lifestyles over traditional practices. Additionally, modernization could lead to the commercialization of cultural practices and festivals, with the focus shifting from cultural significance to financial gain.

Overall, the impact of modernization on Jilin province's cultural heritage in the long run will depend on how it is balanced with the preservation and promotion of traditional practices and festivals.
